etymology.description: 氵(水) (shuǐ, "water") + 普(普) (pǔ, "universal") = water flowing universally -> widespread
etymology.interpretation: The character 溥(pǔ, "widespread") combines the water radical 氵(水) (shuǐ, "water") with 普(普) (pǔ, "universal") to convey the idea of water spreading everywhere, symbolizing breadth or expansion.

examples.chinese: 他的影响力溥及各行各业(他的影響力溥及各行各業)。
examples.pinyin: Tā de yǐngxiǎnglì pǔ jí gè háng gè yè.
examples.english: His influence extends to every walk of life.

examples.chinese: 好消息溥传村庄(好消息溥傳村莊)，欢笑充满街道(歡笑充滿街道)。
examples.pinyin: Hǎo xiāoxī pǔ chuán cūnzhuāng, huānxiào chōngmǎn jiēdào.
examples.english: Good news spreads throughout the village, and laughter fills the streets.

examples.chinese: 古韵犹存(古韻猶存)，艺术溥润心灵(藝術溥潤心靈)。
examples.pinyin: Gǔ yùn yóu cún, yìshù pǔ rùn xīnlíng.
examples.english: Ancient charm still exists, and art extensively nourishes the soul.
